text: Pretty average christmas beer. Pours dark brown in the glass with a quite small foamy head. Taste is dried fruits and roasted almonds.

Appearance Pours a clear deep brownish red, with a dense tan head with good lacing 
Aroma Fruity English ale yeast, dried fruits, liquorice, burnt sugar, nuts, and hints of spices 
Taste Sweet up front, with a dry finish, and a well-rounded bitterness 
Palate Medium-full body, mild carbonation
Clear deep mahogany body, offwhite head. Aroma has bready kvass, dried fruits and cola. Flavour adds malts, nuts, some roasted notes and bread. Astringent, enough bitterness, dry. Balanced and good.
Bottle, 33 cl, shared with Rolf L. Decent christmas ale, prominent initially, then smoother finish.

33cl bottl from a trade with omhper, many thanks! Pours hazy reddish brown colour with a huge good lasting tan head. Aroma of medium sweet dark malt, ripe red fruits, dry and medium bitter hops. Taste of dark malt, sweet malt, dark bread, caramel, red fruits, spruce, quite nice!
@ Kristoffers väg 20/12-16. Bottle from Systembolaget. Malty and spicy with roasted notes. Body is medium, the finish is dry with spices.

330 ml bottle. BB 27/04/2018. HHOK XX. Courtesy of Brandman.
Clear dark copper brown color with a small off-white head. 
Coke, dark malt, sweetness and Old Ale notes in the aroma. 
Nuts, toasty malt, dryness, bitterness, dark fruits, peanuts and Old Ale in the flavor. Really English.

Pours from bottle clear dark brown with minimal tan head -- looks like coke in a glass. Aroma sticky date pudding. Taste medium sweet. Palate medium body, sticky texture, soft carbonation, long finish growing in bitterness. Overall nice example of a Christmas ale.

Kopparfärgad med medelstort gräddvitt skum. Maltig doft med torkad frukt (russin, fikon) och aningen kryddighet. Maltig smak med sötma av russin och fikon, en bra beska kommer och balanserar bra mot sötman. En smakrik och bra julöl utan att sticka ut på något sätt.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with a small cream head. Aroma had notes of caramel and christmas spices. Taste is sweet but has a nice bitter finish.

Pours clear nut brown with high off-white fluffy head. Aroma is caramel, malts, cedar, some oak, wood, dry, vintage, old clothes. Taste is creamy, bitter, sour, toasted, beans, caramel, a lot of wood, some brown sugar, light coffee, oak. Super beer!
.5l bottle @Harrys. Pours clear dark reddish brown with medium off-white head. Aroma is dark malts, dried fruits, some hops, hint of smoke. Flavor is mostly same with some alcohol notes and bread.
Bottle. Pours brown with small white head. Aroma: malty, weak caramel, hay, roast. Taste is sweet and bitter, malty, hay, berries, resin. Medium body. Bitter finish. Ok.
clear mahagony liquid with minimal head. aroma of roasted malts, caramel, tastes same, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour. medium body,
Brown color, beige head. Bread nose, yeast, caramel, light fruity, licorice. Caramel taste, malty, moderate sweetness, fruity, hints of coffee and licorice. Medium body, soft carbonation.

Pours very dark brown with a medium foany tan head. Aromas of roasted malts, chocolate, orange zest, spiced dark bread. Taste is roasted nuts and slight bitterness. Mouthfeel is slightly thin with medium carbonation.

500ml bottle from Systembolaget. Clear mahogany with a creamy tanned head, good lacing. Malty nose, caramel and dark dried fruit. Medium carbonated, light and smooth mouthfeel. Malty caramel taste, dark sugar, toffee, dried fruit. Dry finish with mild smookey and woody notes.

Bottle.
Clear, dark brown red, white head.
Aroma of burned caramel
Raset sweet, full body, round. Bitter bread feel, 
Tart.

caramel, roasty, leather, floral, earthy, cooked vegetables, black, brown, clear, minimal head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, salty, medium body, oily feel, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,
0,5l on tap @ Pikkulintu. Pours clear deep chestnut with a low creamy off-white head. Aroma is slightly roasted malts. Flavor is slightly roasted, nutty and spicy malts with some hops. Decent.
Tap at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Colour is clear dark copper with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Some spices, harshness, caramel, some dry fruits, some hops and strong malts.

Bottle from SB 150117.
Pours a beautiful clear dark ruby with a nicely lacing beige head. 
Very malty nose. Sweet heavy malty taste with some nutmeg. Feeling like a Mild. Hint of coffee. 
Good good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On bottle with Visionthing , thanks a lot! Copper colored, good foam . Medium aroma intensity; malt, dried fruits, some citrus & ok yeast influence. Medium body & complexity. Good bitterness & balance. Enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50cl bottle from Systembolaget, Strömstad. Pours clear copper coloured with an off-white head. Malty aroma with some spicy, caramelly and fruity notes, raisins and hints of herbs. Sweet, malty and somewhat fruity with hints of spices and a medium bitter finish. Well balanced and quite tasty. Nice Christmas beer, but still a bit too much on the sweet side.

Flaske 500ml fra Systembolaget, Kiruna. Drukket i Skibotn 26 Des 14. Dyp rødbrun. Lavt skum med litt farge. Antydning til lacing. Beskjeden maltaroma. Smaken er litt fruktig med en økende syrlig bitterhet. Ettersmak av krydder.

500ml bottle from Systembolaget Kiruna, via djoeye. Deep brown coloured body, ruby highlights to the content. Rocky, beige head slowly diminishing. Spotty lacing. Roasted aroma with notes of earth, nuts and coffee. Malty flavours, more burnt than roasted. Hints of wood, liquorice and choco-caramel followed by citrus peels towards the ending, Medium bodied. Pleasing and tasty (Tromsø 26.12.2014).

Poured from bottle, dark brown with low off white head. Aroma with notes of caramel, dark bread and some butterscotch. Taste is full and fairly well balanced, not too sweet but could have used some more bitterness.

Bottle 0,5l. Pours a dark brown colour with a off-white head. Aroma of raisins, figs along with a rich caramel base with fudge and chocolate. A light hoppy touch of pine and red berries and a medium bitter ending.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from my European Secret Santa, many thanks Per.  Dark chestnut brown color with medium beige head. Caramel, dark malt, plums, spices in aroma. Fruity taste with prunes, dark berries, roasted notes, dark chocolate, spices. Dry hoppy bitter finish. Tasty Christmas beer.
500ml bottle from Systembolaget. Pours dark copper. Aroma is nutty and malty. Taste is fruity and slightly roasted. Great christmas beer
Testades tillsammans med Ängöls kalla tider. Sorry Jämtar....Dock karaktärsmässigt riktig. På egen hand habil och fin i juletider.
Bottle. Light sweet malty aroma, some coffee. Fruity and light heavy malts in the flavour. (Hospitalsløkkan, 22.12.2014)

Lite aroma egentlig, og smaken er det jeg ville kalle en Stout og ikke en juleøl. Helt grei å ha hilst på hverandre to ganger, men blir nok ingen ny gjennsynsglede. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flaska SB. Mörkt bärnstensfärgad med lätt skum. Kryddig och rostad doft med fruktighet. Rostad smak med toner av mörk choklad och kavring. Hög och trevlig beska

50cl bottle EU Swapped 7.0 by PMgep, takk så mycket och god jul! Cherry coke and raisin nose, beautiful deep red-brown colour with thick frothy head. Taste is like an amped ESB that is aware of the existence of Belgian dubbels beyond the border: smooth yeast profile, raisin, nuts and grape lemonade, before obviously international fruity hops (label mentions 5) set in. Easy drinking, finishing on an assertive walnut bitterness. Original, none too sweet Xmas beer that tastes much better than its silly amateur label would lead to suspect...
Good and tasty yuleale. This is what I like. Must buy another one soon. Would probably be perfect with "svineribbe" because of good bubbles.

Flaska från SB. Brunröd vätska med två fingrar högt skum. Doft av mörkt matbröd och karamelliserat socker. Maltig och fyllig smak med bra beska. Något torr. Medelfyllig och bra eftersmak. Julöl med stort J.

500 ml bottle. Clear dark copper with off white head. Smell is malty with roasted and syrupy hints. Taste is light caramel malty with burnt sugar, roasted malt and bitter hoppy finish. Dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation. Nice!
50cl bottle. Creamy light brown head. Dark brown clear color. Aroma is sugar, caramel, maple syrup. Taste is sweet of birch sap, oak.
@ Havregatan 141122. Bottle (500 ml) from Systembolaget (27:-). Sweet malty and fruity with spicy and roasted notes, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter and malty.

Good fawn top with copper body, clear. Thick fawn lacing.
Scents of dark dried fruits, juicy roasted malts, spices, toffee, berry peels.
Tongue gets dark roasted malts, juicy hops, spicy resin, citric peels, raisin, 
sour fruits, cocoa, berries. Ok body, soft carbonation, brown-cocoaish finish. 
Interesting and flexible beer, for solid dishes of meat, or as an evening sipper.
This is a good beer for christmas eves, new year eves and so on. Good brew
 [50cl brown bottle, abv6.5%, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Kiruna, 3, #145, BB20/09/15, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */öme]

Pours clear deep burgundy with about a finger of light tan head. Aroma of light caramel, citrus, bread and spices. Taste is sweet caramel and lightly bitter and spicy. Finish is sweet, body is light and smooth with soft carbonation.

Brun i färgen, kryddig god maltig/söt smak som hänger med i eftersmaken. Lagom styrka. Flaska från Systembolaget.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Systembolaget. Clear amber with a small off-white head. Aroma holds biscuit, caramel, roasted malt, light dried fruits and spices. Light bitter with a malty roasted sweetness, medium body.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Brown colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Spices, malt, fruit.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, hops, dark fruit, spices.
Rødbrun klar med beige skum. Malt, karamell/toffe, urter. Medium søt, medium bitter. medium kullsyre. kort ettersmak

The aroma of malt and oats. Sweet taste of fruit almost a little floral flavor too. Decent aftertaste with some bitterness. One of the better English strong ale I had drunk. But it was not as impressive as I thought it would be. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Dark wooden colour. Yellow lasting head. Smells of citrus, predominantly of grapefruit. Nothing strong. Tastes bitterly of citrus and chocolate. A little heavy on its own. Didnt settle properly in my stomach if you get me. I expect it to be better alongside food. I still enjoyed it and would recommend it.
UPDATED: DEC 14, 2013 Farmhouse, cacao, and straw aroma. Similar taste, but also hints of raspberries and caramel.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2014 500ml bottle, pours opaque dark mahogany with a small tan head. Aroma and taste of roasted malt, prunes, caramel and muscovado. Light sweetness and medium bitterness. Medium body, smooth texture and average carbonation. Less sweet and better balanced than most Swedish Christmas beers, low on spices however. A pleasant tasty beer overall.
500 ml bottle, rated from backlog. Dark ruby with tan head. Aroma is sweet, honey, fruit, grass and malt. Taste is well balanced with a bit of dried fruit, citrus and sweet malt.

500ml bottle. Dark brown with some yellow tones. White foamy crown with a dash of brown. Sweet and fruity flavor with elements of wort bread, citrus and spices. Medium, bitter aftertaste with orange peel and burnt bread. Medium carbonation with small, sparkling bubbles. Medium body.

Nice x-mas brew from Jämtlands.

Bottle traded with Cunningham. Lots of caramel and chocolate in the aroma, with dried fruit and earthy hops thrown in. Full, dark, chocolatey, malty body. Light sweetish with a dryish finish and a rather strong, earthy bitterness plus some roasted notes. This brewery manages to brew English beers that taste more English than those from England. Very nice!

Doften påminner om doft och smak från lageröl  fast någo kraftigare, dock vet jag inte varifrån den kommer ifrån. Smaken påminner även den om lageröl med maltiga inslag och en svag syra. Kroppen är okej men ölen upplever jag som obalanserad.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Clear brown with a lasting beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, light chocolate and moderate hoppy. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. Very drinkable. 231212
UPDATED: APR 15, 2013 En frisk och lagom söt julöl. Smak och doft av malt, torkad frukt, lätt kolsyrad och besk. Välbalanserad. Har provat denna öl sedan 2006, står sig gott.

Aroma: The smell has a mixture of sweet, honey, tones and fruit, like grapefruit, with a malty, grass-like, stamina.Appearance: This beer pours with a light tan compact foam that leaves some lace. It is very dark with a ruby red tone.Taste: The taste is very pleasantly balanced, leaving a good long bitterness. The sweetness reminds you of dried dates and figs, acid from citric fruits like Seville oranges.Palate: A good refreshing carbonation makes the beer high-scoring in all aspects.Overall: Serving type: bottleNote: bottle Reviewed 2010-01-01.
A bit dark and quiet tasteful dinner time beer but as a stand alone christmas beer I wouldnt choose it
Bottle from Systembolaget. 26 SEK. Tested yesterday evening at the yearly Winter/Christmas seasonal brew testing.
Jämtlands julöl är en av anleningarna till att vuxna kan ha det minst lika roligt som barn på julafton. Perfekt balanserad och går att njuta av avsevärt mycket längre än julklappar och Kalle Anka.
Reddish dark brown with low head. Nutty, sweet aroma. Earthy, sweet taste, rather long bitterness.
Pours clear red brown with off white head. Aroma of fruits, caramel and some spices. Taste is dry and bitter with berries, caramel and spices.
Bottle sample at a tasting at Dagans place. Thanks DSG. Nut brown colour, clear, off white head. Liquorice, wormwood, sweet malt aroma. Ash, bitter taste. Light body, light carbonation, ashy finish.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Dagans place. Thanks omhper for this bottle! Clear dark amber-brown with a an off-white head. Aroma of malt, fruits, caramel and honey notes. Sweet malty flavor with fruits, caramel, a hint of alcohol and a slightly drier finish. Medium-bodied.

0.5l bottle shared with The Tasting Crew & friends. Pours a clear deep ruby-brown body with a small bubbly quite sidesticking head. Its a bit dusty with cardboard, dark malts, wort and a hint of chocolate. Its average - quite comfortable carbonated and has a nice oily texture. Tastes alright, light cocoa powder, cold coffee, some licorice-like tones, a mild bitterness all the way. Ends light mouthdrying with a hint of chocolate and some acidity. Nice enough. 13.04.2012

Bottle shared with (and great courtasy of) the fantastic Bergen tasting crew with such stars as ClubGonzo, Inbreak and Palme, and the mighty StoreMy. Has clear and deep brown colour with a small light beige head. Aromas of chocolate, bacon, leather, and some roast, anis and spices. A lot of dried fruits in the flavour with wood, oak, leather, and some pepper. Has a nice richness, and some oily and slick mouth feel. Bitterness = light+. A good christmas beer, but maybe not fully balanced.
Deep amber colour with a small off-white head. Moderate sweet aroma. Toffe and fruity flavour. Tasty and enjoyable chritmas beer.[Bottle from Systembolaget in Strömstad, Sweden]

Bottle, shared with Bergen Beer Geek Tasting Crews Epic Abstrakt/Blåbær tasting, feat. special guests Foffern and StoreMy. :-) Deep coppery amber body, small off-white head. Nose is raisins, coca-cola, hints of herbs, dark malts and caramel. Taste is present caramel, dark malts, molasses and sawdust (mostly in the aftertaste). Wood-ish, dry aftertaste with a slightly parching touch. A pretty decent Christmas ale.

[Thanks to omhper]. Dark amber colour with a frothy and creamy off-white head. Pefect lasting and nice lacing. Aroma has nutty traces, malty and caramelish. Flavour has notes of caramel, moderate toasted malts, bready, nuts and a final slightly bittery with an average duration. Carbonation is soft. Body is medium to high. Texture is slightly creamy.
Mörkt rödbrun öl med smutsvitt gräddigt skum. Doft av rostad malt, bränt socker och mörkt bröd. Söt maltig smak med inslag av torkad frukt. Lätt rostade toner. Går bra till julbordet

2x 500 ml bottles courtesy of Roland. 2010 and 2011 vintage. Consumed on December 26. --- 2011: Pours amber with a small off-white head that quickly dissipates without leaving much trace on the glass. Smell is subtle with some caramel, toffee and sweet fruits. Taste is sweet and slightly bitter with toffee, caramel, figs, dates and some cloves. Finish is slightly sweet and slightly bitter. 7,3,7,3,15. --- 2010: Looks the same as this years vintage. Smell is much more developed with toffee, caramel and a chocolate character that I cant find in the newer vintage. Taste is toffee and cocoa with hints of oxidation. Theres also some dates, caramel but I cant find the cloves I found in the 2011. Finish is sweet with some chocolate fudge. 8,3,6,3,15. --- Quite interesting that there was such a prominent difference.
Stora och fina smaker av kaffe och knäck, för en julöl lagom avvägt mellan beska och sötma. Doftar danskt rågbröd och mörk sirap.
Pours black with low head. Aromas are malty, fudgy, bready. Find the palate being better than most christmas beers, quite full and rich. Taste is ok not more.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours clear ruby dark brown with a huge tanned head leaving lacing. Aroma is fruity, malty, toasted and a bit soapy. Flavor is malty, acidy, roasted, fruity and bitter. A bit watery thin body. Finishes bitter malty.

50cl bottle. Pours brown with a small light brown head. Smells caramell roasted malt. Tastes smoky roasted malt with a bitter smoky finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle.
Pours a medium copper, with a white head.
Fairly roasted aroma, caramel, quite fruity, hops, dried fruits, almonds, nuts, wax, chocolate.
Off-dry, medium body and bitterness, creamy CO2.
Fruity, malty taste, caramel, light roast, dried fruits, nuts, toffee, hops, chocolate, slightly yeasty/earthy. (2011-12-14)
Pours dark brown with a off-white head. A lot of raisins, figs along with a rich caramel base with fudge and chocolate. A light hoppy touch of pine and red berries and a medium bitter ending.

Bottle from Systembolaget, at home. December, 2011. 

Pours dark brown with a clear red hue and a off white creamy head. Slightly sweet, nutty aroma with notes of roasted malt, sweet bread, caramel, and butter. Full taste and body with notes of dried fruit, figs and plums. Some spicy malt, bread and warming alcohol towards the end.
Bottle. Well balanced christmas beers. Notes of coffee, nuts, and dark fruits. A bit hoppy. Quite creamy. Nice.

Bottle.Trade with omhper. Many thanks Per ! Dar amber color, small froathy off white head. Roasty and nutty malt aroma. Sweet malty taste,nuts, ripe fruit, some coffee. Full bodied , finishes surprisingly dry. nice one !

Bottle.
Clear chestnut red with a medium crackling beige head that leaves some minor lacings.

The first whiff of the same old buttery toffee as always in Jämtlands, then comes a vinous tobacco spicy fruity aroma with some chocolate.

Taste is extremely malty and a bit rough with burnt earthy tobacco notes and dark fruit. Vinous. Chocolate in the aftertaste with peppery herbs. Feels much stronger than it is and it stings the tongue a bit.

Full bodied with a soft but tickling carbonation.

A well made but quite rough malt bomb.
Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm in december 2010. Black with a big creamy head. A really nice christmas beer.

Närandra lägger energi på fyndiga etiketter satsar Jämtland på stabil välgjord ale i engelsk anda. Mahognyfärgad med lågt skum. Doft av jord, blommig EKG-humle och mörkt sött bröd. Fyllig, lätt sötma, brödig, fin blommig och jordig humlekaraktär. Liten syrlig metallisk eftersmak som stör lite. En välgjord ESB som passar utmärkt till julens rätter.

Bottle. Dark copper with a creamy light brown head that leaves some lacing. Aroma: malty and fruity, but which fruit? Taste. roasted malt, fruit, some chocolate, caramel, some orange and grapefruit, hints of licorice and spices, medium bitter with some acidity. Medium-bodied with a carbonation that is close to fizzy. Pretty nice winter ale.

One of my Christmas favourites. Deep dark brown-red colour with a nice frothy off-white head. Deep toasty and roasty malt flavours with dark fruity and chocolatey notes with earthy english hops. Medium bittersweet with a lasting finish. A great companion to the Christmas foods.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma is a bit spicy, slight hints of christmas spices. Appearance is red and brown with a nice foam. Taste is mostly bitter with some spices, its not very christmasy but among its competitors this year its one of the better.

clear amber smooth offwhite head.
sweet malty aroma, dark caramel.
flavor is sweet, flowery, caramelly.

Great malty character. Somewhat sweet, bready, spicy, and with a large body and decent light brown head - all of which fits the Christmas beer style. Though, can be slightly overpowering due to its full-bodied sweetness: should be drunk to food, not as a stand-alone. Some bitterness that lingers on, and a reminiscence of strong Scottish ale. Nice dark brownish-red color. Good to great-ish, but far from extreme.
Heavy malty aroma. Huge, creamy, off-white head. Excellent lacing. Fully lasting longevity. Clear, amber body. Flavor is moderate bitter, light smoked and caramelic. Medium palate.

Bottle 500ml. @ home.Clear dark red amber color with a average to large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, light light beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, hay, roasted, caramel, spicy, dark berry, light hoppy, citrus - orange. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, peppery and alcoholic finish. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20100125]
bottele,aroma caramel, roasty, chocolate, color brown, liquid clear, head off white., finish long finish,
Bottle. Frothy off-white good mostly lasting head. Dark amber colour. Heavy malty and light hoppy aroma. Powerfull roasted chocolate flavor. Long chocolate finsih. Creamy palate. Great stuff.
Bottle. Clear dark amber colour with okay head. Very nice flavour with chocolate and burnt malt. Bitter hoppy flavour.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is dark amber. Aroma and taste are caramel, malt, hops and notes of chocolate.
Dark amber with an off white head - tastes of sweet malts with some roasted malts and some hop bitterness - nice

Bottle. Red-brownish, clear liquid with a medium-sized, off-white head. Aroma is a bit buttery and sugary with some fruitiness and a hint of yeast. Taste is richer, with a nice sweetness and some notes of spices, but unfortunately also butter. A decent but not very good Swedish christmas beer.

It poured a very dark, clear, red liquid with a large beige foam that left a nice lacing.

Weak smell of bread and spices. A hint of ginger, but it was hard to pinpoint the different spices as they where quite subtile. My guess is it was a mix of dried orange peels, ginger and cloves.

Fairly smooth mouthfeel with a medium body. Taste of caramell, dark bread and spices. Once again Im leaning towards cloves and ginger. Not a bad beer but it gets a bit lost in the competition at the moment.
Välkomponerad smakbild med snyggt utplacerade balanspunkter. Kraftfull samtidigt som den är mild och varlig. Jämtlands bryggeri vet vad kvalitet innebär.

Pours nice and dark. Looks very christmasey.
Lots of herbs and spices. Syrup, malts, dark fruits, yeast and bitter flowers.
Will do good on the christmas table. could do with a higher alcohol rate.

50cl bottle. Wonderful darkred colour with big beige head. Aroma is sweet and a bit spicy. Taste is malty with some lacorice and nuts. Taste is quite long with a nice bittness I really enjoy. Perfect for Christmas.

Bottle from 2008. Dark red-brown with a large head

Malty aroma with caramel, spices, raisins and fruit.

Tastes malt, caramel, nuts and grapefruit. Nice bitterness. Aftertaste was quite long. A good "Christmas-beer".

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2010 Bottle 2009 edition. Christmas tasting 2009-11-27
AR: wee hoppyness
AP: dark brown body, bubbly white head
F: medium low bitterness, some spicyness - a bit boring, this one have been much better before (earlier editons)

2008 edition
Färg: Lapsang suchong. Skum: försvann.
Doft: humle, vörtbröd
Smak: humle (amerikansk), sesamfrö/nötter (kollade in systembolaget - de hittar grapefrukt???)
Köp i parti och minut passar som standard dryck till julbordet.

Har smakat bättre förr? Eller har konkurrenterna blivt för bra? 
Provdatum: 2008-12-23

Draught? Bottle?(Stockholm Beer Festival 2009) - Dark brown with red tinges. Fruity and slightly smoky aroma with ash and dried fruit. Fruity taste with raisins, caramel, spicy malt and marzipan. The finish is fruity and slightly sweet.

(Bottle, BBE 03/08 -- thanks Kolbjørn -- on 2009-02-18) Very deep reddish brown. Small white head. Raisin and malts in aroma. Full bodied and dry palate with little carbonation. Raisin, roastedness, bitterness, sweetness and hint of chocolate in taste. Raisin in aftertaste.

500 ml bottle. Dark brown colourl. Clear. Small white fine-laced
  head. Toffee-like aroma with hints of raisins and chocolate. Hints
  of pepper. Smooth texture. Rich malty flavours. Slightly roasted,
  but mostly dark sweet malts. Low on the hops, except for a little
  dry hop bitterness in the finish.

Keg (Oliver Twist)
Anna says: Red-brown.  Aroma of light hops.  Slight sour-fruits accompanies a restrained bitterness for a refined taste.  A little sweetness and spices (with a hint of zest perhaps) but quite drinkable because they are not overdone. Unusually, Phil did not share this.
Flaske. mørkebrun øl med et tydeligt duftindtryk af alkohol og nødder. Fin humlebitterhed efter en let brændt øl der ikke er så julet igen, hvilket er meget lækkert.

Bottle, bought at Systembolaget, Malmö. Thank you, myrup. Pours great mahogany with a small, frothy/creamy, off-white head. Mild aroma, some roasted malts, a little fruitiness and general sweetness. Medium carbonation, fine mouthfeel - light dryness. Fine malty flavour, light chocolate, fine roasted malts. Good dryness. Some light cherries with some light hoppiness. Really nice and very drinkable.

Bottle from Systembolaget.
Dark brown-red with a off-white head. 
Tastes almoast like a porter.

500 ml bottle. Big coarse, lightly tanned head. Lasting with fine lacework. Brilliant dark ruby-brown body. Inviting malty and fruity aroma. Suggestions of mild spices and chocolate. Chocolate-ish malt flavor, fruits and spices and a nice rounded sweetness, balanced by a gentle hopbitterness. Medium body. Feels soft and smooth in the mouth. Malty, mild bitter ending. I like this a lot.

Bottle 081129. This one might be a bit off, but most likely its just not a good batch. Yeasty and sourish aroma and flavor. Not much aromatics otherwise. I seem to get a lot of badly made Jämtland beer these days...
Bottle 50 cl. Pours a dark brown/red color. Aroma is fruity with some roasted malt. Mouthfeel is smooth and nice. Taste is dark fruits,spice and some rosted malt.

Medium light brown head. Deep dark barely translucent red body. Light roasty sooty aroma with sugary fruity notes. Dry-sweetish roasty minty taste with resiny chocolatey notes. Lightish body. Mild mouthfeel. Dry burnt spicy licorice and chocolate aftertaste with light acidity. Nice, drinkable. (0.5l bottle from gr0ve.)

creamy beige head. Colour is almost black. Aroma is hoppy, spicy, caramel, dark fruit. Flavour is sweet, spicy I think I note some flavour of coffee and chocolate. There is a very nice biterness to this beer. This year’s edition is much better than last year’s.

Dark ruby beer, bottled.
Rich and malty. Sweet, a little burned sugar. Some hoppy dryness, though it comes across as too sweet.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2009 Pours a dark red/brown color in my Jämtlands glass. It has a nice foamy head. A bit of lacing.

Aroma is interesting of caramel, very malty, some toffee notes along with a typical fruitiness.

Flavour is malty, caramely (very caramely actually) with a good bitterness. Notes of citrus, some aromatic hops, toffee and dried fruits, it also got a slightly burnt note with a bit of nuttiness. Overall very balanced and tasty. Theres also some special Jämtland note, which I tend too find in moast of there beer. Here it makes it very well with the other flavours, so nothing negative about that.

Mouthfeel is quite smooth and filling with a certain "bite" in it.

A very drinkable and nice Christmas beer, Im glad I finally tried it.

One of the very best beers from Jämtlands together with the Postiljon ESB. Rich flavours of different nuts, a nice hint of raisins and som liquorice too! Have to buy som more of these next christmas, only got to lay my hands on one..

50 cl bottle - Christmasy nutty color with a medium sized disappearin head. Chocolate and roasted nuts rich aroma. Malty flavor which mixes well with medium heavy bitterness. One of the better swedish Christmas ales!

2007 bottle. Pours a reddish brown colour with a beige head. Winter spices and hoppy on the nose - also some sweet liquorice, dried fruits and coffee. Smooth mouthfeel but a bit watery. Some sweetness. Some roasted and earthy notes - liquorice, spices and coffee. The finish is a bit thin with some bitterness. I was a bit disappointed with this one.
2007 bottle. Almost opaque dark ruby with medium head. Aroma of toffee, red wine, dark sugar. Taste is caramel and butter, finishing with a nice bitterness and some alcohol sting.
50 cl bottle. Dark brown color, big off-white head. Nice sweetness, malt and fruit. Fine hoppy bitterness. God jul!
This is almost a meal in a glass. Full of flowers in the nose and a complex palate. Fullbodied with a sweet and bitter ending.

50cl bottle from Systembolaget.   Transparent, dark brown with a medium-thin beige head.   Roasty chocolate aroma is a little sweet and has some hops thrown in as well.   The flavor is pretty roasty too, with plenty of sweet chocolate and a distinct hoppiness and bitter finish.   Almost stoutish in the roast department.   Medium body with lots of carbonation, finished pretty clean.   I love the hops in Jämtlands beers, and the Christmas brew blends that perfectly into a nice rich, roasty ale.
Bottle. Bark, brownish with a large but disappearing head. Fruit, caramel and some hops. Low carbonization. Roasted in taste. Short, dry aftertaste.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2008 Bottle. Dark red-brown color with a fluffy but mostly diminishing pale brown head. Aroma of dark fruit, spices, toffee, caramel and hops. The taste has notes of roasted malt, dark fruits, chocolate, spices, toffee, caramel and alcohol. The finish is bitter, dry and lightly rosted.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2010 A bit flat, sweet and with notes of chocolate. That is how I would describe the taste of this x-mas brew. Not as much cascade as I had expected, which is not necissarily a bad thing.

Bottled, BB 03/07.  Poured a really cool shade of clear garnet with a medium, well-retained cap of beige head.  The aroma picked up sweet, lightly-spiced English toffee and caramel notes.. rather dusty overall, with very good dark fruit coming through with warmth.  The flavor shows quite a bit of degredation.. sour oxidation notes had a rather vinous quality.. toffee and some spices at the core.. finished with some sour cardboard and dark fruit.  Medium-bodied and sour on the palate, but you could tell that this was good deep down.
Bottle. Hazy brown colour with a nice foamy head. Aroma of spices, caramel, malt and anis. Flavour of spices such as anis, cinnamon and burned caramel.
Sweet aroma but also some salty meat among the chocolate. Flavour seems and odd clash of sweet malts and almost sour tasting hops(?). Not bad but feels schizo.

Bottle. Average creamy off-white head that mostly diminished. Light brown color with a clear flat body. Aroma of caramel, grain, orange peel, hint of chocolate and Christmas spice, roasted malt, floral, brown sugar. Medium bodied with an average carbonation and a light alcoholic texture. Moderated sweet flavor with light bitter notes. Light bitter finish. Ok Christmas beer. 08-07-2007

From 50 cL bottle. Pours hazy light brown with chalk white lacing head. Malty sweet and orange fruity aroma. Flavour is malty, slight smoked with a light orange note before the finish. Dry bitter finish.

Vintage 2006. Dark amber with a red hue and a nice creamy head. The aroma is hoppy and spicy with notes of malt. The flavour has nice hoppy notes and a good bitterness, notes of fruit, roasted malt and caramel. Sadly also a bit of alcohol, that brings the flavour a slightly out of balance, and makes it a bit edgy and not as harmonic as the other lovely Jämtland beers. But its quite nice anyhow. 1837

Bottle courtesy of omhper.  Pours brown with a rocky white head.  Smells of soap, perfume, citrus, some sweet malt.  Taste is of raisins, spices, pepper and some tea like hints.  Lots of wintery flavors and aromas packed into this one.  Very nice!

Clear dark brown with a big lacy off-white head. Aroma is a pleasant and uncomplicated mix of chocolate, caramel and spicy German hops. Flavour is suprisingly earthy, with a light sweetness and some roast chocolate and nutty flavours, the hops taste a little green and grassy. From memory, it didnt taste too different from their tiotaggare, which is by no means a bad thing. Overall its very satisfying and a great beer, perfect for Christmas.
bottle. amber color. small head. sweet malty and caramelly taste. sweet and xmasy.
Bottled. Dark amber coloured with a kinda large off white head. Malty and bready with notes of berries, grain and dust. Very lightly hopped.
Bottle - First newbie tasting club - Lars brought it. Brown - offwhite head. Bread, malty, berries, wierd malty, straw, almost no hop... boring !!

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2008 Bottle (50 cl) from Systembolaget. Deep copper color with a thick off-white, almost beige head. Very fruity, complex malt aroma with dried friuts, prunes and figs, and a little roasted note. All backed up by a steady hop character. Medium bodied, with a distinctive bitterness in the aftertaste. The relatively high abv does not reveal itself. An excellent christmas ale.

Bottle - January 2007, thanks to Omhper for sharing!. Pours a deep, clear, red-copper with a finger wide slight head, that diminishes to a small head that accompanies all my pint leaving some lacing behind each sip. Aroma is nice, some caramel and sherry with some red fruits. Tastes fruity, strong caramel, bittersweet, some cider, spices, woody and a subtle vinous vein. Aftertaste is bittersweet and firm, some earthy hops. Chewy mouthfeel. Maybe a bit oxidized but it really fits it. A comforting and solid winter brew.

Bottled (BB 03/2007)
Ruby red color, small but steady coffee head. Nice hoppy aroma (grapefruit, pineapple). Medium-bodied. Cracker malty, pine needles hoppy (Cascade?). Kind of American feeling here. Well balanced winterbier - not very Christmasy though.

Bottled. Dark amber colour, mediumsized beige head. Aroma is spices, malts, slight roast and some coffee. Flavour is bitter dark fruits with a long spicy finish and aftertaste. Some grassyish yeasty notes are present.

50 cl bottle courtesy of Marsiblursi. It pours a ruddy chestnut with a two finger thick tan head that is very fluffy, clingy and lasting. Has a muted hop aroma along with sweet malts, some yeast, light caramel and a lot of baking bread.

Has a lot of fruity esters in the fore then gets very light toasty with a medium hop presence, caramel and caramelized bread notes through the middle and into the finish. This is pretty damn good. It has a definite English feel to it and a dry finish that gets ever so slightly spicy. This is a damn nice beer. The flavor isnt exactly amazing, but the overall feel of the beer is satisfying, making it an enjoyable quaff.

Bottled. Vintage 2006. Hazy reddish brown coloured. Fruity and yeasty aroma with notes of malts and some chocolate. The flavour is quite different from earlier years. Before it was sweet, malty and rather full bodied, this year it is more yeasty and fruity with a rather sharp bitter finish and less body. They need to get rid of that yeastyness and get the body and balance back for 2007. This used to be an excellent brew.

Bottled. Dark red/brown in colour, rich creamy beige head, lacings. The aroma is malty and sweet. Caramel  and something else as well, cant say what. The flavour is a mixture of malt and caramel. There is a sweet aftertaste. Nice.

Aroma: nice, fruity with hints of red apples, cloudberry, cinnamon, several different malts. Fruity, fresh hops accompany the malts superbly. Burnt sugar, coconut (vaguely), liquorice, cream & almonds. 
Appearance: pale beige head that fizzes away in a matter of seconds, leaving as suspect looking island in the middle. Rusty red brown, clear colour. 
Flavour: initial dry spicyness - lovely. Apparent hop bitterness w/ sourish-sweet malt, caramel/hop aftertaste. Overall very balanced, fruity and refreshing. Noticable alcohol. 
Palate: really nice considering the high co2. Full-bodied, smooth yet crisp.

Bottle. Aroma: Fruity with some caramel and hops, however shadowed by a slight sour and burnt / rubbery touch. 
Flavor: 
Surprisingly thin caramel / toffé compared to other years. Some rubbery notes and a heavy sharp and metal like bitterness. Hops are not apperent until it warms up.
Bottle. Deep amber/red. Malty throughout with hints of hops. Lacking in some way.. Slightly disappointed, but I find Jämtlands to be slightly hyped..

(Draught at Oliver Twist, Stockholm) Dark amber colour with ruby notes, brief off-white head. Fruity nose with notes of dried apricots, wort, caramel, cherries, chocolate, spices (cinnamon, ginger) and hops (grapefruit). Malty, fruity taste with notes of caramel, chocolate, toffee, wort, citrus (blood oranges, grapefruit) and a heavy spicy bitterness in the finish. Very well balanced. Lovely!

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2013 First ratingInitial Rating Date: 11/19/200650 cl bottle from Swedish Systembolaget.Fruity and malty a bit chocolate scent, some sourness and burnt rubber. Some hops in the back. Clear red brown color, tan head. Full mouthfeel. Lots of smoke and metal, coffee and burnt taste. Low hop bitterness, but astringent and sharp tannins puckering mouthfeel. High CO2 spritziness. Some spices and alcohol. Cascade like hoppy taste when it warms up. All in all not as good as I had expected it to be.5/3/5/3/10=2.6Rerate50 cl bottle thanks to Daniel (not on ratebeer). Sampled on December 23, 2012.Clear brown color, big teal head. Sweet, malty, caramel, fudge scent. Sweet, buttery, bitter taste. Dry finish. Smooth mouthfeel, high dry bitterness.7/4/6/4/13=3.4Rerate50 cl bottle at Haket, Göteborg. On November 30, 2013.BB 05-14Clear dark brown color, small off-white head. Grainy, malty, alcohol scent. Sweet, malty, grainy, bitter taste. Bitter aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel, medium high to high bitterness.6/3/6/4/12=3.1

Pours dark brown/red. Caramellish with roasted hints. Some chocolate and hints of fruits. Sour. Nutmeg and crispbread. Peppery with rubber. Sour flavour, toffeeish malt. Citric peels and pepper in the aftertaste. Hints of liquorice. Grape and orange hoppyness. Medium body.
Bottle "aged" 9 month, Flowery, some fudge, little burnt taste, dark with off-white head. Doesnt seem too improve by ageing.
UPDATED: NOV 13, 2006 Pale amber with a thick pale foam. Malty and fruity notes (citrus ?). Medium body with a dry finish.

50cl - Best before 4/06 - Thanks MrWalker - Aroma of toasted malts and nuts, sprouts, and a bit of spice.  Pours transparent mahagony with a medium head and good lacing.  Flavor matches aroma with more roastiness and a touch of cranberry.  Palate is sticky.  A pretty tasty easy drinking brew.

Tested 21-november 2005.
A dark red body, with a nice white foam.Lots of cacade in the aroma, and a medium body, with  caramel and chocolate arom. Long smoth finish.
0.5l bottled Dark amber color, thick head, low carbonation, a nice julol Malty taste, with chocloate and sticking sweetness. Well composed beer but could use some less chocolatemalt

Bottle 2005 Edition. Swedish julöl that usually gets the top score among swedish julöl. One of the best editions in the last years. Pours dark brown with foamy head. A bit sweet, but roasted and hoppy. A little taste of licorice. Goes well with smorgasbord food.
Deep amber colour with longlasting off-white head. Malty aroma with hints of licourice. Malty flavour with hints of licourice and caramel. Some hop flavor too. Malty aftertaste.
Raisins and toffe nose, dark brown color, foamy head. Heavy sweet molasses body, like Coke at times. Light peaty, toasted malt end. Nice thick body. Alcohol warms going down. Excellent Danish Julöl.

Thanks Secret Santa Joss - that is a wonderful Gift! Deep red colored with a medium forth head on top. Cranberry, raisons and port nose - medium intense. Milkchocolate taste, again Cranberry in the beginning also roasted malt with a great hoppy finish. Nice  Julöl!
Bottle, Dark brown. Aroma of raisins, honey and the usual "smell of Jämtland". Sweet taste, much of everything, some taste of liquorice in the aftertaste.
Dark red with a off-white head. Malty sweet and caramel aroma. The taste is malty and has a graet bitternes. Hoho, mary X-Mas!

Bottle, at home.
I bought this beer because of Rick Gordon - thanks! Redbrown with a large light creamy beige head, good lacings, mostly diminishing. Aroma moderate to heavy malty and hoppy (caramel, vanilla, licorice). Flavor moderate to heavy sweet and bitter, long duration, well balanced. Medium body, oily, soft carbonated.

Pours dark amber with a thick, creamy tan head. Yeasty, toffe-ish nose with the usual Jämtlands house character. Some nuttyness is present. Spicy, slight hoppy flavour with some notes of yeast. Acidic and bitter in finish.
BottleFinally I got down to rate this. Have had it every year and enjoyed it. A rich head and the house aroma we all love is there. Very good balance of malts and hops. Fullbodied and moreish.
2003 edition. Malty and sweet nose, with some spices. Dark borwn beer, with a small off-white head. Malty flavor, sweet and buttery.
2003 edition. Amber reddish beer with a small off white head. Malty and fruity aroma with a light buttery note. Malty and nutty flavor with a light caramel sweetness.
Vintage 03. Pours a dark brown, with a white head. Aroma is of fruit, malts, and butter. Taste is sweet malty, with notes of butter
Bottle. 2003. Butter fruity aroma and a sweet fruity malty taste. Medium body and a light dry finish.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2007 Bottle.
2006-edition.
Clear orange brown coloured with an off white head.
Aroma of caramel, fruits and hops.
Flavour of malts, caramel, fruits and hops.

Light hazy nut-brown colored beer with medium creamy beige head. Nice nutty aroma with touches of roasted and coffee flavoured caramels. In the nose also a touch of hops and herbs. The body of this beer is a bit thin. It has touches of malts a light roasted malts with a neutal nuttyness. In the end you have hints of dry caramel and the bitterness of the hops.
Thanks Joris for this beer.

(500ml bottle) Pours a deep red body with a creamy, quick-dissipating almond head. Nose of butterscotch (best before March 2005). Roasted malt flavour with coffee tones. Interesting English Strong??? Thanks to Lubiere for the try.

Deep burgundy brown with a light moka head. Nice sweet malt with intense butterscotch, almost too buttery. Nice sweet  malt, with good nutty notes. Buttery and oily mouthfeel with warm alcohol. Rich and full. Thanks Joris!

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2005 (Bottle 50 cl) Very dark brown, almost black with a rather small head and rather low carbonation. Top-fermented and very malty with a good bitterness and an underlying sweetness. Very full-bodied. Actually reminds me of a Belgian "Dubbel". 090603

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2005 Rerate - previously sampled at the RBESP 2004, but it had a hard time to push through in that line-up, I was happy to be able to try it again
Red brown, tanned creamy head.
Roasted notes, nut , chocolate, minerally strawberry. Slightly cardboardy bready malt.
Good body, mellow mouthfeel. Milk chocolate and nut aftertaste. Vey nice harmonious brew.

On tap at Oliver Twist, Stockholm. Dark brown body with a thin beige head. Superb sweet and fruity aroma with notes of brown sugar and blackberries. Robust malty taste that hides the alcohol pretty well. Its bitter and roasty finish leaves a pleasant warming effect. God Jul!

Bottle. The colour is clear dark brown with a small tint of red. The pale beige foam is finger thick with a small crater.

The smell is explicit Jämtlands Bryggeri with lots of aroma hops. Otherwise, it is quite bitter, but there are also some roasted malts, dried apricots, oranges, and a delicate sour chemical hint. 

The carbonation is pleasant and fresh with small bubbles.

The taste is loaded with a balance of sweetness and a grand bitterness. There are some flavours of roasted malt, dried fruits (apples, apricots, raisins). The bitterness is quite complex. I noted that I couldnt even trace any alcohol, which is quite impressing at 6.5%. If I should try to summon this well crafted taste, it would be something like A straightforward and very skilful winter brew.  The long and pleasant aftertaste got lots of aroma and bitter hops, mixed with some slowly developing citric notes.

Oh yes, you have probably already guessed it: Jämtlands Bryggeri has won my testing of all available Swedish Christmas beers. No one should be surprised, really: This is the perfect way to end a hard Christmas day.
Bottle. Dark brown colour. Small white head. Fruity aroma. Malty flavour with a hint of smoke. Very nice beer.

Sweet, nutty malt aroma. Dark brown body with generous off-white head that recedes to nice cover. Sweet, malty, nutty, woody, earthy, caramel flavour with some herbal hops. Very complex. Smooth body and soft carbonation. Medium-light body works to advantage in this one. Very good, flirts with excellence. Bottle enjoyed with MartinT, muzzlehatch and Rastacouere. Thanks, Per.

Dec 2004, Swedish dregs, Alts etc tasting w/MartinT, tiggmtl and Rastacouere #15.  Bottle.  Dark hazelnut color, fairly clear...bit of decaying head...malty, lightly spicy nose features caramel and juniper...spicy/woody flavors with a touch of late cinnamon, lovely thick malt, perhaps a touch too much carbonation but quite nice overall.

Earthy brown rum sweetness laying the foundation for some able grassy hop bitterness...Caramel and cherry candy make for a solid malt body, as hop pepperiness takes over somewhat roughly...Malt sweetness soon reconciles and reclaims its dominion though...Thanks Per!!...

Dark soil brown with ruby hints. Tiny off-white head. Big citrusy hop part in the aroma. Chocolate, meat, earth, orange and spice notes. Dominant citrus and earth taste component fail at hiding pleasant caramel and nutty complements. Fairly good balance: Very hoppy palate, but not agressively dry and it made it stand out a good bit from the similar hopped pilgrim. Very good even if it could be more complex. Surprisingly thin (this seems to be the case with most of the swedish beers Ive had), but in this case once again, it seems fitting and nicely watery, again with this fine water jamtlands seems to be using. I havent had many ESA yet, but 2 of those were in the last week and both kicked major bottoms. Cheers Per!
UPDATED: DEC 17, 2004 First a warning, this one is stronger than what one would expect. This is genuine christmas with strong elements of caramel, fruit, chocolate and not least malt.

(Bottled) Dark reddish brown color with small head. Aromatic and flowery hopped, even wineous aroma. Flowery, quite hoppy, woody and reasonably malty flavor with some spiciness. Quite smooth but bitter, medium-bodied, soft-carbonated palate. A very nice, hoppy and tasty ale. Like Postiljon with added spiciness for christmas.

Dark amber color, litlle light brown head. Rich aroma: sweetness and spicyness coming from hops. Spicy and chocolate flavor with sweet start, ending is somehow alcoholic with very dry aftertaste. Medium to full body, nice brew.

Dark redbrown with pretty good beige head.
Malty aroma with tones of coffee and roasted malt. A bit hoppy.
Caramel flavour with fruity tones. Quite low bitterness for being a Jämtlands beer

Sweet malty spice aroma, vanilla and toffee. Buttery. Twizzlers. Dark red-amber clear with thin off-white lacing head. Silky body with light carbonation. Starts sweet with dry hop presence, malts. Nice notes of vanilla, oak. Alcoholic warming. Finish is light sweet, toffee, and cinammon. Light bitter after.

Brilliant red-amber coloured beer with a small head. Light roasted spicy, christmasy, aroma.  The taste is a complex mixture of light sweetness, spice, roasted malt and perfume. Dry roasted finish. A very nice beer.

Medium dark ruby red with a medium size shortish lasting medium beige head. Festive, treacley malty with hint of bootpolish butterscotch and alcohol. Mild warming gentle caressing body. Medium roasted malt bitter, and low sweetness some spcies and jelly baby perfume. Wornderful comples

Spicy and strong aroma of cloves, cinnamon, cardemom and orange. Flavour starts with an exploding spice and herb combination. Then moves over to a mild and dry middle and a deliciously soft finish. The aftertaste keeps on for long with a combination of citric fruits and dry, roasted cocoa and coffee notes. The palate is overwhelming and stabile. A very delicious brew!
A very good swedish X-mas beer. The beer has a fruity aroma, and so is the taste, but there is also a hint of spice, that makes the taste complete. The aftertaste is slighty sweet.
A complicated beer from the best brewery in Sweden. quite complete in taste body and aftertaste...
Deep chestnut color with a beige head. The taste is sweet and hoppy. It finishes slight weak.
This is almost a meal in a glass. Full of flowers in the nose and a complex palate. Fullbodied with a sweet and bitter ending.

Dark brown with clear reddish shine; slim white head. Dark sweetish chocolate in the nose, bit of dark fruit, even vinous. Taste of dark, but not bitter chocolate. There is a bit of malt sweetness in this beer. Character of dessert wine. Although little carbonation visually, very obvious in the mouthfeel. Rather refreshing beer! Medium bodied. Warming up gives coffee notes, but never bitter. Strange beer. I think that, poured from a dark container, one could fool quite a lot of people making them believe this is anything but beer. It certainly isn't bad.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2003 My first Swedish christmas beer and what a surprise!! I bought this beer because two different Swedish guys I talked to at Systembolaget told me that this beer was great. And they were so right!!
Very nice creamy beige head though fast disappearing. Aroma is sweet, malt and flowers. Taste is sweet with tones of nut. Little alcoholic aftertaste. Very nice!!
Dark, looks like coco-cola. Has a great aroma frpom tofee, but the flavor is way too bitter. Especially the finish is hard to handle.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2004 RERATE: On tap at Plain Kitchen, Goteborg, Sweden. This is a good example of how a very good beer gets even better on tap. Great toffee and vanilla aroma with butterscotch. Malty butterscotchy flavor with vanilla notes, mixed with a nice hoppy bitterness.  A favourite, thats for sure.


Old rating: Amber color, with a nice creamy and lasting brownish head. Aroma is very good from toffee and caramel, maybe some citrus in it as well. Has a good palate and flavor starts in a rather mild way. Then it turns into quite a bitterness. A little roasted, maybe just a little too bitter. (8/3/6/4/15)

Bottled.
Dark amber. A nutty, vanilla aroma; almost vinous.
Soft and smooth palate.
A hoppy, nutty flavour.

Bottled. 
Dark copper colour with a rich off-white head. Lots of caramel in the aroma. Rich hoppy flavour of roasted malts, vanilla and some licorice.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2003 Yeah, it has dark amber colour with hints of ruby. Beautiful big, long-lasting and creamy off-white head. Hoppy, fruity and slightly spicy aroma with hints of caramel and nuts. Smooth choclate flavour. Spices, coffee, caramel and some roasted notes. Finish is dominated by earthy hops, which is balanced with some malty creamy caramel notes. Great!

The aroma is sweet, nutty, and yeasty with notes of chocolate. The color is nut brown and it has a beutiful light brown head. The flavor is fantastic: it is sweet and nutty with notes of bitter chocolate and roasted malt. It finishes on a nice mixed sweet and bitter note with the bitterness lingering for a long time and turning woody dry at last. The bitterness comes more the malt than the hops. The body is a little weak for a beer of 6.5% ABV, but is OK. A great beer - thanks Per.

Ruby-dark amber color; generous head. Strange aroma, with some malt, hop, caramel, phenol, fudge. Not very strong body, but enough pleasant, with an extra light note of roasted barley. Dry ordinary palate, quite strong but not enough aromatic, with a touch of sourness. Not bad, but diminished by something chemical.

Dark Brown color.  Pours with a medium head - classic looking dark beer.  Sweet and fruity, I like the flavor, but it is not as malty as many of the other strong ale's I've had.  A slight roast and carmel flavor does come through with some hop bitterness.  Slight bitterness on the finish.  Good Beer
Oily, fruity with a hint of honey, amber-colored ale designed special for winter. Very cool label (very thin paper though :)

The best Swedish Christmas Ale 2002 according to all (3) tastings I had in december: A fullbodied ale with a perfect balance between the sweetness and the bitterness.But in my opinion not a beer for the Swedish Smorgosbord, this ale is best enjoyed as an apertif or a digestif.
Perfect beer for Christmas night.
Nice one. Dark and mushy, bitter and sweet, adult candy by the christmas fire. More!

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2004 Bottled: Dark ruby. High carbonation. Very nice foam. It has a very pleasant - and christmaslike - aroma. Notes of spices and some yeast. Nice. Flavour is spicy, smoothe, well-balanced and has strong notes of coffee. Very nice bitterness in the end. One of the best Scandinavian christmasbrews, I've tasted.
UPDATED: DEC 7, 2010 Bottled:Pours dark brown with a dense head. Aroma is a bit sour with notes of berries and peat. Fruity, somewhat sour and peaty flavour. Long bitterness.
Deep red in colour, spicy bitterness, had a sugary/gassy fizziness on the tongue and a sticky hop finish as jbrus mentions.
Wheak aroma, yeasty and light roasted/chocolate. Dark ruby colour, off-white frothy head, good lacing. Sweet, warm, full, light roasted, light bitter, malty. Very sticky sweet finish with nice hops.

Dark nut brown with rich head. Flowery and chocolatey aroma. Fruity and full bodied with nice malt profile. 
Surprisingly dry. Finishes like dark bitter chocolate. More on the malty side and less hoppy than the average ale from Jämtlands Bryggeri, and one of my very favourite Swedish brews.
Dark auburn color.  Tarty malt and dark fruit, slighlty organic nose.  Malty sweet, raisin, good balance.  Very nicely done.
red-brown colour, big head, fine spicy aroma, very malty, long bitter and spicy finish - very satisfying

Dark mahogany hued ale, subtley spiced with what tastes like cinnamon and orange zest, but also with good
dark malt character and the trademark earthy hoppiness and notes of cocoa.  A little sweeter than your average Jamtlands.
